1.text: Mash 1 large ripe banana in a bowl.

2.text: Add in eggs, baking powder, and cinnamon.

3.text: Heat 2 tsp (8.4 g) of butter in a skillet.

4.text: Spoon the batter onto the skillet, then cook it for 2 to 3 minutes.

5.text: Flip the pancake when the batter starts to bubble.

6.text: Make the rest of your pancakes using up your batter.

7.text: Mash 2 bananas in a large bowl.

8.text: Mix in the eggs, vanilla, oats, and cinnamon.

9.text: Heat some butter in a skillet.

10.text: Scoop out your pancake batter onto the skillet.

11.text: Let the pancake cook for 2 to 3 minutes, then flip it.

12.text: Garnish your pancakes with some yummy toppings.

13.text: Blend 1.5 cups (354 g) of oats in a blender.

14.text: Combine the oat flour with baking soda, salt, and walnuts.

15.text: Add the mashed banana, vanilla, maple syrup, and plant-based milk.

16.text: Spray canola oil on a nonstick skillet.

17.text: Spoon pancake batter onto the skillet, then let it cook for 2 minutes.

18.text: Flip your pancake and let it cook for another 2 minutes.

19.text: Mash 1 ripe banana in a large bowl.

20.text: Combine the egg, coconut flour, baking powder, and cinnamon.

21.text: Grease a skillet with coconut oil.

22.text: Spoon the batter onto the skillet and cook it for 2 minutes.

23.text: Flip the pancake, then serve them up while they’re still warm.

24.text: Add flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl.

25.text: Combine the milk, banana, egg, maple syrup, and vanilla in a small bowl.

26.text: Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.

27.text: Grease a skillet with butter or coconut oil.

28.text: Scoop the batter out onto a hot skillet.

29.text: Cook each pancake for 2 to 3 minutes on both sides.
